alert.note: Alert for Clay; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 19 at 1:13AM CST until January 22 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lincoln IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Little Wabash River below Clay City affecting Clay and Richland Counties. .Heavy rain of 1 to 2 inches occurred over portions of the Little Wabash River basin on Wednesday, resulting in rapid rises on the river. Flooding near Clay City is expected to develop this afternoon. The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Wabash River below Clay City. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding begins to wooded areas and agricultural land immediately adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 18.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Little Wabash River Clay City 18.0 13.6 Thu 12 am CS 18.3 18.2 17.8 &&
